post_text:
STUDENTS CAN RETURN 9/21!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton students may return to campus for in-person instruction on Monday, September 21, as per the Otsego County Department of Health.

School officially opens for all students this Monday (September 14) in our virtual-learning model, which GMU will follow for one week. Students should log on for virtual learning with their homeroom teachers by 7:50 a.m. every school day next week.

Our hybrid-learning model will begin September 21, with half of our students in the building for in-person instruction and half learning remotely on school days. Click below for more information!
#GMUnity #GMUFamily #QualityOfTheJourney #SchoolsReopening

post_text:
**IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 11**

ALL of our buses will be leaving the school between 10:30-11:00am to make deliveries to each home! If you are participating in our meal program, meals for next week will be delivered, along with learning items needed for the first day of school on Monday, September 14. If no one is home, we will leave your items near your door. Please know that if you have not already, you will be hearing from your homeroom teacher before the end of the day tomorrow, Friday, September 11. Homeroom teachers will be touching base with each student, making sure they are ready to log onto school by 7:50am on Monday morning!

A robo call with this information will be going out later this evening. We hope you and your families are well!

GMU TO START SCHOOL AS VIRTUAL-ONLY
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton will begin the 2020-2021 school year September 14 with a virtual-only learning model for all students, based on the recommendation of the Otsego County Department of Health.

Virtual-only instruction at GMU will continue through September 23, at which time the situation will be re-evaluated.

No students may attend school in person from September 14-23, including those who participate in BOCES programs.

Click the link below for more information.
#GMUnity #GMUFamily #QualityOfTheJourney #SchoolsReopening

post_text:
**Community Forum Thursday

Here at GMU we value the quality of the journey, and want to give parents another opportunity to hear a review of our reopening plan as we journey toward the start of school this fall. Our Community Forum sessions will be held at various times in the hopes that one of the times will work for those who missed our first presentation or for those who have additional questions. These Forums will be held on ZOOM on Thursday, August 20th at 10 a.m., 2 p.m. and 5:30 p.m.

For more information or for the link to join the Zoom meeting, please call Kristy Carey at 607-783-2207, ext. 103.

REOPENING REMINDER
GMU will host a community forum at 6 p.m. Tuesday (8/4/2020) to discuss our school reopening plan.

Up to 50 people may attend our forum in person (masks and proper social distancing required). The forum also will be live-streamed online via Zoom. A transcript will be available 72 hours after the forum is completed.

Click the link below to see our Reopening Plan Presentation, which will be discussed at the Community Forum.

https://www.gmucsd.org/Downloads/GMU-080320-Powerpoint-Reopening-School-Community-Forum-PDF2.pdf

For more information, including how you can join via Zoom, call Jarrin Hayen at 607-783-2207, ext. 140.

post_text:
GMU SENIOR TO HELP NYSPHSAA
Congratulations to GMU senior Gavin Bonczkowski, one of 11 new members on the New York State Public High School Athletic Association's Student-Athlete Advisory Committee!

The SAAC is comprised of two student-athletes from each of New York's 11 sections. Gavin and Candor junior Shelby Swartz will represent Section IV on the SAAC in 2020-2021.

During the 2019-20 school year, the committee continued to promote the NYSPHSAA Mental Health Awareness Week and focused additional efforts on student-athletes mental health during the COVID-19 pandemic. The SAAC also provided input in the expansion of NYSPHSAA Coaches Appreciation Day and Officials Appreciation Day.

This year, the committee will continue to promote the mental health initiative and provide feedback on Executive and Central Committee proposals.

A total of 95 student-athletes applied to be members of this year’s SAAC.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #NYSPHSAA2020

REMINDER: MILK/FOOD GIVEAWAY WEDNESDAY!
The Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Central School District will host a Milk and Food Giveaway from 1-6 p.m. Wednesday at the school (693 State Highway 51, Gilbertsville, NY 13776).

This drive-through event is OPEN TO EVERYONE, with 3,000 gallons of milk from the Dairy Farmers of America, Inc. and about 1,000 boxes of produce from Renzi Foodservice available.

Each vehicle is eligible to receive two gallons of milk and one box of produce (while supplies last).

Please remain in your vehicle during distribution. Walk-ups are not permitted. No registration or paperwork is required.

FALL SPORTS WILL BE DELAYED
Officers of the New York State Public High School Athletic Association voted Thursday to delay the start of the 2020 Fall Sports season until September 21.

Should the COVID-19 health crisis further disrupt the 2020 Fall Sports season, the NYSPHSAA will implement short-season schedules for all high school sports starting in January 2021.

Click the NYSPHSAA link below to read more about the future of high school sports in New York.

post_text:
SUMMER READING CHALLENGE!
Our 2020 Summer Reading Challenge is set to begin July 1!

The challenge is for all Gilbertsville-Mount Upton students in Pre-Kindergarten to Fifth Grade to read (or be read aloud to) for at least 20 minutes, five days per week.

Students must fill out a calendar to record their reading each week. You may print out the two calendar pages from the attached document, create your own paper calendar/recording sheet, or pick up a packet in the main office.

Students will return their completed calendars on the first day of school or submit them to Lauren Weidman virtually. Our Reading Celebration may have to look a little different this fall, but we’ll still have something amazing for the students!

If you have any questions, please email lweidman@gmucsd.org.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #SummerReading2020

SCHOLARSHIP WINNERS!
Congratulations to the following Gilbertsville-Mount Upton students for earning Clark Foundation scholarship grants this year:

Savannah L. Bresee, Ethan Charron, Kalvyn Pauline Cole, Zachary Michael Grabo, Sawyer Grant Hinman, Vanessa Nicole Nelson, Ethan Mark Newman, Kyli Teagan Odell, Samuel Robert Piedmonte, Tavian Ezra Raymond, Sadra Smith, Isaiah Cole Stockdale and Airyana Mae Wright.

A total of 188 area students received first-year college scholarship grants from the Clark Foundation. Academic achievement, citizenship qualities and service to communities and schools are among the criteria for these scholarship grants.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #ClarkFoundationScholarships2020

post_text:
CONGRATULATIONS, CHELSEA!
In case you missed it, GMU senior Chelsea Pope was inducted into the National Technical Honor Society on Wednesday night!

Chelsea was part of the Culinary Arts Program at Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES during the 2019-2020 school year. She plans to major in Baking and Pastry at Paul Smith's College this fall.

To be considered for NTHS inductions, students must submit an essay, a resume and three recommendations. GPA, attendance, community service and involvement in extracurricular activities also help determine NTHS eligibility of students, who are also subject to an interview process.

NTHS recognizes and celebrates the knowledge, skill, honesty, service, responsibility, scholarship, citizenship and leadership of its inductees. Click this link to see the entire 2019-2020 NTHS Induction Ceremony on YouTube: https://youtu.be/3Y6k9V1kQR8?t=1

Great job, Chelsea!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #NTHSInductions2020

post_text:
MAIL-IN VOTING EXTENDED
Per the latest Executive Order from Governor Cuomo, the deadline for mailed-in absentee ballots pertaining to budget votes and school elections has been extended until 5 p.m. Tuesday, June 16, 2020.

The deadline to hand-deliver ballots to the school remains 5 p.m. Tuesday, June 9. Please deposit your ballots in the locked ballot box inside the front entrance of the school.

All other votes must be received by mail by 5 p.m. Tuesday June 16, 2020.

If you still have not received a ballot but would like one, please call Jarrin Hayen at 607-783-2207.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #Voting2020

post_text:
THE WRITE STUFF!
Congratulations to our very own Tyler Crisell, who recently placed in the PBS KIDS Writers Contest!

Tyler’s “Spy Kid and Captain Canine” submission won third place in the second-grade division. He is a student in Darin Trass’ second-grade class at Gilbertsville-Mount Upton.

The contest was open to students in grades K-3 who reside in WSKG’s coverage area, which includes 21 counties in New York and Pennsylvania.

Located in Vestal, WSKG Public TV & Radio is operated by WSKG Public Telecommunications Council, a private non-profit corporation chartered by the Board of Regents of the State University of New York in association with the New York State Education Department.

Great job, Tyler!!!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #WritersContest2020
thedailystar.com The Evening Sun Gilbertsville Library

Gilbertsville-Mount Upton celebrates the following staff members for reaching service milestones during the 2019-2020 academic year.

~ 25 years: Stephen Cimineri, Margaret Lackos, Nancy Parshall, Terry Wilber
~ 20 years: Cindy Ketchum, Ormand Moore
~ 15 years: Theresa Bennett, Deb Davies

post_text:
FALL MUSICAL SIGN-UPS!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton is planning its Fall Musical production of “The Pirates of Penzance,” which is scheduled to run November 12-14 under the direction of Mrs. Winnie Sortman.

Students entering grades 8-12 this fall who would like to audition or join the stage crew should email Mrs. Monaco (amonaco@gmucsd.org) or Mrs. Sortman (sortmanwinnie@gmail.com), or call our main office at 607-782-2207 for more information. You may contact Mrs. Monaco through Zoom and Mrs. Sortman through Facebook Messenger as well.

Parents who are interested in helping with set construction should contact Mrs. Monaco or Mrs. Sortman using the same methods.

Information packets will be mailed to interested students on Monday, June 8. As of today, dates for tryouts and rehearsals are pending because of the COVID-19 pandemic.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #FallMusical2020

The Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Chapter of the National Honor Society welcomes you to its 2020 Virtual Induction Ceremony!

Our new inductees have worked hard to get to this moment and while we can’t be together physically, we did come together virtually to celebrate their accomplishments.

Please watch this virtual ceremony honoring GMU National Honor Society 2020 inductees Anika Christensen, Angelina Correll, Kailah Davis, Maya Farwell, Zach Grabo, Morgan Keuhn, Ashlyn Marron, Dylan McVey, Kyle Meyers, Nicole Meyers, Madeline Pain, Dalton Proskine, Lauren Radwan, Isaiah Stockdale and Skye Wilson!

post_text:
REMEMBER TO VOTE!
Voting for Gilbertsville-Mount Upton’s 2020-2021 School Budget and Board of Education will take place through absentee ballots because of the COVID-19 pandemic, as per NY state.

Absentee ballots must be mailed back or dropped off at the school by 5 p.m. Tuesday, June 9, 2020. If you did not receive an absentee ballot, please call Jarrin Hayen at 607-783-2207.

Click the images below to view GMU’s 2020-2021 School Budget Flyer and Board of Education candidate bios.

GMU also will host a Budget Hearing via Zoom at 7:30 a.m. Monday, June 1, 2020. The link to the Budget Hearing Zoom meeting is posted on GMU’s Board of Education webpage at https://www.gmucsd.org/BoardofEd.aspx.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #BudgetVote #BOEElection
thedailystar.com The Evening Sun pressconnects.com / Press & Sun-Bulletin WBNG 12 News WZOZ 103.1FM AllOtsego.com Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES

post_text:
FACE VALUE!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton thanks “The Mask Factory,” a group of nine women who made facemasks for all of our students to wear!

Nancy Callahan, Liz Campion, Joann Curtis, Michele Farwell, Kathryn Gibson, Barbara Pistor, Carrie Mae Smith, Liz Stebbins and Teresa Winchester started “The Mask Factory” about six weeks ago. Since then, they’ve created nearly 1,000 facemasks for EMT workers, the Office for the Aging, Chase Memorial Nursing Home & Rehab, the Butternut Food Pantry, family members, friends and now, our GMU students!

Materials for the GMU project were purchased following a successful community fundraiser. Three weeks later, “The Mask Factory” delivered 346 facemasks to the school and $900 to the food pantry, all to the delight of Superintendent Annette Hammond and her staff.

GMU will distribute the masks to students soon, so stay tuned!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney
thedailystar.com The Evening Sun WBNG 12 News pressconnects.com / Press & Sun-Bulletin Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES Gilbertsville, New York Mount Upton, New York

post_text:
HAPPY HUNTING!
Over the past two weeks, Mr. DuVall's Physical Education class participated in a scavenger hunt in hopes of getting students outside, exercising and reducing screen time.

Congratulations to our contest winners – Carrie Doyle, Gabriella Barnes and Gianna Barnes – who will receive a $5 Stewart's Shops ice cream card and a jump rope!

Thanks to all of the kids who participated and remember to stay active and get outside!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #ScavengerHunt2020

post_text:
ART THAT ROCKS!
Ashley Hughes reports that her GMU seventh-grade art students are “rocking it” lately with assignments that fit the bill while school is closed.

Assignment 1: Follow the style of New York City artist Stefanie Trilling, who has been creating Coronavirus parodies of book covers while quarantined.

Assignment 2: Inspired by the artist Cintascotch, incorporate small, handheld objects into your drawings.

Check out all of the creativity and fun in the photos below!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #Art2020

MEET OUR TOP 5 SENIORS!
The Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Central School District is proud to announce the top five academic students in its Class of 2020.

GMU’s graduating class is led by Valedictorian Sadra Smith and Salutatorian Sawyer Hinman. Vanessa Nelson, Ethan Charron and Ethan Newman round out GMU’s top five seniors, who will be formally recognized for their academic excellence during the 2019-2020 school year at a later date.

Click on the link below to read bios on each of our Top 5 Seniors in GMU's Class of 2020!

post_text:
WE STILL HAVE FREE DAIRY FOR YOU!
Holy cow! We've been giving away milk, cheese, yogurt, eggs, ice cream and produce since 10 this morning, and we're still going strong!

As of 3:30 p.m. Wednesday, all of the products listed above are still available at our school. Just drive up, get your free products and go home as a proud supporter of farmers and the dairy industry!

BONUS: There are no lines right now, so there will be little to no wait for your free stuff!

GMU Dairy Giveaway Day is open to EVERYONE until 6 p.m. today or until we run out of supplies. Like, comment and share this post to spread the word!!!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #DairyGiveawayDay2020

post_text:
LOTS OF WAYS TO LEARN!
Darin Trass’ second-graders are certainly keeping busy in finding new ways to learn at home while school is closed!

Henry worked with his brother, Gavin, to make a sled for those snowy days that are hopefully behind us for a while. The two also made a cat condo. Can you see the cat eating food on the bottom level?

Melena submitted a report on mole salamanders, after she and her grandpa found some a few weeks ago.

Melena wrote the following, complete with illustrations: “If you have a mole salamander and you have nothing to feed it, go outside and find worms and termites and grubs. If you have nothing to put your mole salamander in, make your own. Ask your mom for a jar. Find some leaves; they have to be moist.

“If you want to go outside and grab sticks, break the ends of it. If your mole salamander is in it already, take it out and build the bed like this (see drawing). Put the jar in the dark. I am going to show you what a salamander looks like (see drawing).”

Great job, kids! Keep up the good work!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #RemoteLearning2020

#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney
shared_text:
Unatego Central School District
May 6 at 8:50 AM ·

MILK GIVEAWAY
There will be a FREE milk giveaway on this Thursday, May 7th starting at 11:00 am until the supply runs out. Three locations for milk pick up are the Unadilla Elementary School, Unatego Middle/High School and the Otego School parking lots.

This milk giveaway is open to anyone. You do not have to live in the district. All are welcome to come pick up FREE HALF GALLONS OF MILK.
Thank you to Saputo Inc. for the donation of milk.

SENIOR SHOWCASE: CHLOE HOWARD
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton is celebrating its Class of 2020 with pictures and bios of the Senior Class. Today, we recognize …
~ GMU Senior: Chloe Howard
~ Parents: Jody Roberts and Dave Kline
~ Next Step: College at TBA
~ Major: Applied Science
~ Future Career: Emergency Medicine or Neuroscience
~ Favorite GMU Memory: Talking with Mrs. Carey.
~ In Her Own Words: “I want to say a huge THANK YOU to all the teachers and staff members who have pushed me to do my best but also supported me, helped me, and uplifted me in times I needed it the most. I truly don’t know how I would’ve gotten here without the support system I have here at GMU. You all have made such an amazing impact on me that I will never forget. Thank you especially to Mrs. Ruland, Mrs. Wags, Mrs. Delaney, Mrs. DiGorgi and Mrs. Carey. You guys are awesome. I’ll make sure to come back and visit!”
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #SeniorShowcase2020

A DAY FOR TEACHERS!
Happy National Teacher Day!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton thanks all of our teachers for being OUR teachers. Whether students are learning in school or at home, we appreciate everything you do make sure our kids receive the best education possible.
Want to personally thank a teacher? Give your favorites a shout-out in the comments below!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #ThankATeacher #NationalTeacherDay #TeacherAppreciationWeek2020
shared_text:
New York State Education Department
May 5 at 9:05 AM ·

Today is #NationalTeacherDay! We would like to thank all of our teachers who work hard every day to educate and better the lives of our students.

Celebrate National Teacher Day by showing your teacher how much you appreciate them with an email or video, a picture of artwork you made, or a story of how they’ve improved your life. Tag a teacher and let them know how much you appreciate them! NEA Today #ThankATeaacher #TeacherAppreciationWeek #EducatorsAreHeroes

post_text:
THANK YOU, GMU!
Click below to see your favorite GMU faces as the Raiders celebrate Teacher and Staff Appreciation Week!

GMU Superintendent Annette Hammond says:
“Today begins one of my favorite weeks of the year, Teacher and Staff Appreciation Week! On behalf of the GMU Board of Education and myself, I would like to thank all of our Teachers, Aides, Secretaries, Food Service Workers, Custodians, Transportation Staff, and Supervisors for their willingness to always step up and do whatever it takes for our students!

“We have never seen times like we are in now and it has been even more difficult to work in the field of education. GMU has faced much loss and change this year, but our staff continues to embrace the challenge of thinking outside of the box and trying new things to keep doing what is best for our students!

“Thank you for your hard work and dedication to making the Journey great for everyone here at GMU!”
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #ThankATeacher #StaffAppreciationWeek2020

SENIOR SHOWCASE: KELSEY LOCKWOOD
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton is celebrating its Class of 2020 with pictures and bios of the Senior Class. Today, we recognize …
~ GMU Senior: Kelsey Lockwood
~ Parents/Guardians: Maureen and Dwayne Lockwood
~ Next Step: Continue Education at BOCES
~ Major: Cosmetology
~ Future Career: Cosmetologist or Tattoo Artist
~ Favorite GMU Memories: BOCES and hanging out with Owen
~ In Her Own Words: “I would like to thank my family and close teachers for pushing me to do my best, even when I was sure I didn’t want to. I couldn’t and wouldn’t have done it without the love and support of every one of them. The things I’ll miss the most about high school are the long rides to BOCES, laughing with friends, and being able to run to the resource room when I need reassurance about absolutely anything.”
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #SeniorShowcase2020

post_text:
PRE-K PAJAMA PARTY!
GMU Teacher Cathy Thatford hosted a virtual Pre-K Pajama Party, connecting with her students last Friday night via Zoom.

Our Pre-K kids read two of their favorite stories and shared their own with a virtual show-and-tell. They also sang Happy Birthday to Joseph and Xzavior, who celebrated their fifth birthdays over the weekend.

GMU’s Pre-K class always has a blast with Zoom and loves the chance to chat and see each other!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #PreKPajamaParty2020

April 28 at 10:16 AM ·

post_text:
YOU CAN DO IT!
GMU Teacher Darin Trass recently shared these pics of the latest remote-learning creations from his second-graders.

Kaidyn helped make dinner, adding ingredients and placing chicken nuggets where he thought they belonged. He's been a big helper with his brother's homework and around the house.

Hogan writes: “This is my LEGO Dodge Challenger Demon! It took me two days to build. It was a Lego kit. I built it by following the directions.”

Great job, Kaidyn and Hogan!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney

post_text:
SENIOR SHOWCASE: VANESSA NELSON
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton is celebrating its Class of 2020 with pictures and bios of the Senior Class. Today, we recognize …
~ GMU Senior: Vanessa Nelson
~ Parents/Guardians: Jay Reach and Tanya Nelson
~ Next Step: College at Valencia College
~ Major: Undecided
~ Future Career: Move to Florida, get a degree, and make a difference in any way I can.
~ Favorite GMU Memory: Bonding with everyone in the Senior Lounge.
~ In Her Own Words: “I want to thank my parents and family for always being so supportive of my choices; the teachers and staff of GMU for helping me be successful and supporting me; and all my classmates for being a part of shaping who I am. The support system in our school’s community is unparalleled, and I am so thankful that I went to school where I did. I will miss this place and the times that I had here. I’ll never forget the memories I’ve made.”
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #SeniorShowcase2020

post_text:
FROM ALDI, WITH LOVE …
Many thanks to the ALDI grocery store in Oneonta and shift manager Bethany Schidzick for making a “donation of love” to the Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Central School District this past weekend.
ALDI USA donated dozens of bags filled with potatoes and bread to the District, which randomly distributed them Monday to some GMU families that receive weekly food deliveries.
Special thanks to our Superintendent, Annette Hammond, for picking up the donations and adding them to the scheduled deliveries.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #ThankYouALDI2020
thedailystar.com WZOZ 103.1FM AllOtsego.com WBNG 12 News

post_text:
GMU WELCOMES 15 TO NHS
The Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Central School District is proud welcome 15 newcomers to its 2020 National Honor Society!

Our NHS Class of 2020 features Anika Christensen, Angelina Correll, Kailah Davis, Maya Farwell, Zach Grabo, Morgan Keuhn, Ashlyn Marron, Dylan McVey, Kyle Meyers, Nicole Meyers, Madeline Pain, Dalton Proskine, Lauren Radwan, Isaiah Stockdale and Skye Wilson.

National Honor Society members must consistently maintain an cumulative academic average of 90 or higher, exhibit excellent leadership skills, live every day with high moral character, and thrive on the service to others.

A huge congratulations to you all!! You have worked so hard to get to this point and we are all so proud of you!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #NationalHonorSociety2020

post_text:
WHAT ARE YOU DOING?
Darin Trass’ second-graders are doing some amazing things at home while school is closed!

~ Jack made a birdfeeder out of materials that would normally be considered trash. What kinds of birds will be attracted to his feeder?

~ Dylan’s father found an old shelf in their barn, so Dylan scraped the paint off, spray-painted it and then added a fresh coat of paint to restore it.

~ Hunter found frog eggs and tadpoles in his pond! He said they’re the most he’s ever seen in one place.

~ Tyler entered his fiction book, Spy Kid and Captain Canine, into the PBS Kids Writers Contest! Good luck, Tyler!

~ And check out Lily’s video in the comments below. She made a paper airplane to test aerodynamics, then carefully measured the distance with her feet!

Want to share your “homework” with us? Go ahead and post your photos and videos in the comments section. Keep up the great work, kids!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney

post_text:
CLAY ON DISPLAY!
For the last three months, GMU Art students in grades 7-12 have been designing clay tiles.
They chose to create endangered-animal tiles on one board and tiles for plants/flowers on another.
Our wonderful custodians then made wooden "carts" to show off our finished tiles, which will be displayed in our school entrance for a year or so.
Well done, artists!!!!!!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #GMUArt2020

post_text:
NO SCHOOL UNTIL APRIL 15
~ As of Friday, March 27, 2020 ~
Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced Friday that schools would remain closed until April 15, 2020, because of the Coronavirus pandemic, at which time the situation would be reassessed. Schools were initially supposed to be closed for two weeks (March 18-April 1) as per the governor's executive order issued on March 17. Schools will be expected to continue with their plans for child care, meals and distance learning, and the 180-day waiver will remain in effect.
(New York State School Boards Association report)

post_text:
SHOW YOUR SCHOOL SPIRIT!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton will celebrate an All-School Spring Spirit Week from Monday through Friday next week (March 30-April 3).

Students can share Spirit Week photos with teachers in their online classrooms or post them daily in the comments section of our Spirit Week Facebook posts. Parents are encouraged to post Spirit Week pics of their kids on Facebook, too!

You can find our Spirit Week posts on GMU’s Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/GMUCentral/ (@GMUCentral).

Brought to you by HS STUCO, Spring Spirit Week is for all GMU students (grades PK-12) and will follow this schedule:

Monday, March 30: Pajama Day
Tuesday, March 31: Mathlete vs. Athlete Day
Wednesday, April 1: Patriotic Day (Dress to impress Mrs. Delaney)
Thursday, April 2: Rainbow Day (Autism Awareness Day)
Friday, April 3: *Class Colors Day

*Class colors are Seniors-black, Juniors-white, Sophomores-blue, Freshmen-gold, 8-green, 7-red, 6-black, 5-purple, 4-blue, 3-green, 2-yellow, 1-orange, K-red, PK-pink.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #SpringSpiritWeek2020

post_text:
Dear Students, Parents, and Teachers:
With the extra burden now being placed on various online services, learning platforms, and websites, some will "crash" or become non-accessible on occasion.

Many of these services will know that their systems have gone down and will do their best to get them back to operation as soon as they can.

Please exercise patience when these problems occur by waiting 30 - 60 minutes before trying to access a service or website again.

Trying to access a service or website repeatedly over a short amount of time (i.e. "spamming the refresh button") only adds to the problem - it actually creates a "Denial of Service attack" when enough people do this at the same time.

Thank you for your understanding!

Eric Voorhees, Technology Director

post_text:
Dear Students and Parents,
Every GMU student now has a Microsoft Office 365 account available.

This will give every student:
• The ability to communicate with their teachers via email.
• 5 copies of Microsoft Office so that they can do their work on computer, tablet, or phone.
• Storage for their work “in the cloud” using Microsoft OneDrive.
• And it’s all EdLaw / Part 121 compliant for student data privacy.

An email was sent to parents and guardians last night that GMU has an email address for, but not all of them were delivered.

Students may log in to their accounts at:
https://www.outlook.com/gmucsd.org

Please email me at evoorhees@gmucsd.org to get your students' account information. Please realize that it may take some time for me to answer all of your emails.Thank you for your patience during this process!

Eric Voorhees, Technology Director

post_text:
GMU SENDS 18 TO MUSIC FEST
Congratulations to all of our talented students who took part in the All-County Music Festival this past Saturday, March 7, at the Cooperstown Central School District.

All-County participants are selected through an audition process to represent their school districts in a festival featuring the finest musicians in Otsego County NY. An elementary school concert (grades 5-6) is followed by a concert for students in grades 7-12.

The following students represented GMU and music teachers William Gilchrest, Anne Monaco and Deanna Perkosky.

Elementary Band (Pic 1, l-r): Kyle Keuhn, Alivia Plows, Jeffrey Barnes, Lillian Perrine.

Elementary Chorus (Pic 2, l-r): Madison Lockwood, Kylee O’Connell, Jenna Carpenter.

Junior High Band (Pic 3, l-r): Front row, Alyssa Sorochinsky, Emma Peck, Avriel Correll; Back row, Dante Manwarren, Tait Christensen, Connor Eberly, Brennan Finch.

Senior High Chorus (Pic 4, l-r): Anika Christensen, Tavian Raymond, Emily Hammond, Gavin Bonczkowski.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #AllCountyMusic2020

HELICOPTER AT GMU
A helicopter has landed on school property in response to a medical emergency involving a community member who must be air-lifted.

*** This is not a school-related emergency. ***

All students are safely inside our school, where they will remain until the helicopter leaves.

post_text:
WELCOME TO THE HALL!
Congratulations to Jim Johnson and Jessica Talbot on their Section IV Hall of Fame inductions Saturday!
The former Gilbertsville-Mount Upton standouts were honored between Section IV Class D #basketball championship games Saturday afternoon at SUNY Oneonta’s Dewar Arena. They joined official Jamie O’Donnell and former Davenport stars Samantha Meyerhoff and Chelsea Haight during the ceremony.
The five are part of a 24-member Class of 2020 that was officially inducted into the Section IV Hall of Fame on Saturday morning in Binghamton.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SectionIVHallOfFame2020

post_text:
CODE OF THE RAIDERS!
Lauren Weidman’s second-grade readers recently learned about m-bots from our STEAM instruction and education specialist Mark Seigers!

Her class read a book about a robot named Kirobo before this activity, designed to show our kids how to program m-bots using various codes.

They also completed a series of Mr. Seigers’ challenges and wrote about the steps they followed to make the robots perform specific functions.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #STEAM2020

post_text:
B-DEVILS, GMU CELEBRATE READING!
Congratulations to students of Karen Hill and Debra Davies, who recently completed the Binghamton Devils’ Read To The Rink program by reading at least five books apiece!

The AHL team sent its mascot, Devil Dawg, and a guest reader to Gilbertsville-Mount Upton on Tuesday to celebrate. Each GMU first-grader received a free ticket to a B-Devils home game as a reward for reading.

GMU thanks the Binghamton Devils for promoting literacy and helping our students to get excited about reading!
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #BinghamtonDevils2020

Our Soaring Eagles (PK-2) and Grade 3-6 Awards Ceremonies will be on Friday, February 28th:
- The Soaring Eagles ceremony is scheduled for 8:15am
- The ceremony for Grades 3-6 is scheduled for 9:00am

If you are a parent of a student receiving an award, you will receive an automatic call the evening of Friday, February 21st during the following times:
- For Soaring Eagles (PK-2), you will get a call between 6:30 - 7:30pm
- For Grades 3-6, you will get a call between 7:00 - 8:00pm

-Eric Voorhees, Technology Director/CIO

post_text:
CARNATION SALE!
Valentine's Day is quickly approaching and the GMU Class of 2022 is selling carnations that will be delivered to students during their homeroom or first-period class on Friday, February 14.

Flowers cost $2 apiece. Payments are due at the time of order.

Order forms have been sent home in elementary-student folders. Middle/high school students may order flowers during their lunch periods starting next week.

Flowers also may be ordered by emailing Kaitlyn Woods at kwoods@gmucsd.org.

All orders must include student’s name, number of flowers requested, a message for the recipient(s) and how you would like the message to be signed. MS/HS students must note their first period on B days. Elementary students must note their homeroom teacher.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #Carnations2020
text:
CARNATION SALE!
Valentine's Day is quickly approaching and the GMU Class of 2022 is selling carnations that will be delivered to students during their homeroom or first-period class on Friday, February 14.

Flowers cost $2 apiece. Payments are due at the time of order.

Order forms have been sent home in elementary-student folders. Middle/high school students may order flowers during their lunch periods starting next week.

Flowers also may be ordered by emailing Kaitlyn Woods at kwoods@gmucsd.org.

All orders must include student’s name, number of flowers requested, a message for the recipient(s) and how you would like the message to be signed. MS/HS students must note their first period on B days. Elementary students must note their homeroom teacher.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #Carnations2020

post_text:
WHAT'S HAPPENING NOW!
* NHS Chicken Dinner Sale: Gilbertsville-Mount Upton’s National Honor Society will hold a Brooks' BBQ Chicken sale from 4:30-6:30 p.m. Saturday, February 8, before its annual Talent Show. ... Chicken halves ($7) and dinners ($10) will be sold on a first-come, first-served basis and may be picked up in the high school cafeteria. Dinners include macaroni salad, baked beans and a cookie.

* Talent Show: GMU's annual Talent Show will follow at 7 p.m. Saturday in the MS/HS Auditorium. This event is free and open to the public!

* Boys Basketball: Friday's boys basketball home games against Schenevus Central School District, which were snowed out, have been moved to Friday, February 14. Junior varsity begins at 5:30 p.m., followed by a Tri-Valley League varsity playoff game at 7 p.m.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #WinterUpdates2020

post_text:
WE WANT YOUR BOTTLES & CANS!
Support the GMU Safety Patrol Fund by bringing your refundable bottles and cans to school or to Krazy 8 Redemption. Refunds will go toward the GMU Safety Patrol’s trip to Washington, D.C., and Philadelphia later this year.
Krazy 8 Redemption is located at the corner of County Route 33 and State Route 8 in Mount Upton. Can’t make it there? Give Krazy 8 Redemption owner William Barnes a call at 607-764-8107 and he’ll come to you!
Remember to mention “GMU Safety Patrol” to make sure your refund is donated. Thank you in advance for supporting our students!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SafetyPatrolDonations2020

Preferred Mutual is with Worcester Central School and 27 others.
December 18, 2019 at 3:00 PM ·

The Preferred Mutual Foundation Is Now Accepting Scholarship Applications!

To be eligible for the scholarship, a student must:
🎓 Be a current high school senior in Otsego, Delaware, or Chenango Counties in New York.
🎓 Have a grade-point average of 95 or better.
🎓 Plan to enroll in a full-time baccalaureate program at an accredited college or university in fall 2020.

For more information and to apply, please visit: http://ow.ly/mx9250xDuA6

post_text:
FREE FOOD IN 2020
The United Way of Delaware & Otsego Counties will distribute free food from the Regional Food Bank of Northeastern New York on the last Wednesday of every month in 2020.

Food will be distributed at Northern Eagle Beverages, Inc. (41 Browne St., Oneonta) until it’s gone starting at 10 a.m. on the following Wednesdays: January 29, February 26, March 25, April 29, May 27, June 24, July 29, August 26, September 30, October 28, November 25 and December 30.

This food distribution is open to all and no forms are required to participate. For more information, please call Valerie Adams at 607-267-2091 or email her at vadams@unitedwaydo.org.
#GMUnity #QualityOfTheJourney #FoodDistribution2020
thedailystar.com The Evening Sun pressconnects.com / Press & Sun-Bulletin WBNG 12 News Spectrum News NY1 The Reporter Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES

SIGN UP FOR ALUMNI HOOPS!
Join us for the second annual GMU Alumni Hoops game at 1 p.m. March 28 in the High School Gymnasium!

All GMU graduates are invited to play in the Blue vs. Gold battle, which benefits the GMU Board of Education Student Scholarship Fund.

Admission is $5 for adults and $3 for students (ages 6-and-under are free). The event also features $1 half-court shots, a 50/50 drawing and concessions.

To sign up, call GMU Administrative Assistant to the Superintendent Jarrin Hayen at 607-783-2207, ext. 140, or email her at jhayen@gmucsd.org.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #AlumniHoops2020

post_text:
IT'S TIME TO WRESTLE!
A message from GMU Elementary Physical Education Teacher Greg DuVall:
"Our school district has a great opportunity to be part of a youth wrestling program, combined with the Unadilla Valley Central School District.
"Wrestling is the world's oldest sport and teaches kids vital life lessons pertaining to work ethic, self-respect, dedication, etc. Wrestling also develops strength and endurance. Poor health is a major issue in our society today, and #wrestling will help develop a love of exercise and physical fitness in our youth.
"If you have a son or daughter who is interested in wrestling, please like our Facebook page (link below) and bring your child to practice.
"Practices run from 5:30-7 p.m. Tuesdays and Thursdays in the Unadilla Valley wrestling room. Our next practice is tomorrow (Tuesday, January 7). Hope to see you there!"
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #Wrestling2020

post_text:
OUR KIDS ARE ALL-WRITE!
Darin Trass’ second-graders invited family and friends to their Writing Celebration on Thursday (December 20) at Gilbertsville-Mount Upton.
Guests listened to narrative stories written by the students, who have been adding “Writer's Moves” such as dialogue, beginnings and endings that matter, and comparisons.
Thanks to everyone who stopped by and congratulations to our second-grade authors!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #WritingCelebration2019

#BLESSED
Thanks to Pastor Piedmonte for kicking off our our annual Senior Citizen Holiday Luncheon with this wonderful blessing.

Our cafeteria is packed and the food, as always, is terrific!

Special thanks to our Board of Education for serving these super senior citizens and guest stars such as Assemblyman Cliff Crouch, Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES District Superintendent Perry Dewey and Josh Rosenblatt WBNG of WBNG 12 News!

Be sure to check back later for dozens of pictures from this fun holiday event!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SeniorCitizenHolidayLuncheon2019

GMU GRAD CONNECTS WITH VIKING
Check out Gilbertsville-Mount Upton graduate Meghan Gordon Gadbois (Class of 2000) getting some major face time in the Weatherly Report, a weekly #video segment hosted by Minnesota Vikings #football player Stephen Weatherly!
Defensive end Weatherly explores jobs outside of football every week. This week, he looked at some of the things scientists do at Ecolab. Meghan's piece starts just before the 3-minute mark.
Click here to see the entire video:
https://www.vikings.com/video/the-weatherly-report-scientist

post_text:
BOE MEETING, CONCERT TONIGHT!
Come for the meeting, stay for the show!

The Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Central School District will hold a regular Board of Education meeting at 5:30 p.m. today in the Board Room.

As always, the Board welcomes public participation during the Public Comment portion of regular meetings. For more information on public participation, visit https://www.gmucsd.org/PublicParticipation.aspx online.

GMU also invites the public to its annual Winter Choral Concert, scheduled to start at 6:30 p.m. today in the auditorium.

Questions? Call the District Office at 607-783-2207.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #BOE2019 #WinterConcert2019

QUARTER AUCTION 12/14!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton will host a Quarter Auction to support the GMU Marching Band and Color Guard on December 14.

The event opens with a preview at 5:15 p.m., followed by the auction at 6 p.m. Admission is $5 per person and includes four bidding paddles.

Bring your quarters and join in the fun. Refreshments will be available. All proceeds will benefit the GMU Marching Band and Color Guard.

post_text:
SPECIAL DELIVERY!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton’s Backpack Program will have plenty to share this year thanks to the Sidney Elks Lodge #2175s’ Club #2175.

Elks’ Club representatives Sharon Harris and Marge Johnson stopped by this morning to drop off brand new clothing, boots, sneakers, toiletries and other items for our Backpack Program, which benefits students in our district.

Sharon (center) and Marge joined GMU Librarian and Backpack Program Coordinator Raquel Norton (right) for a quick pic in the library after making the donation, made possible by a $2,000 grant that Harris solicited from the Elks National Foundation. The grant also will be used to help students at Sidney Central School District and Bainbridge-Guilford Central School.

#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #BackpackProgram2019
Gilbertsville, New York Mount Upton, New York thedailystar.com The Evening Sun Gilbertsville Free Library Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES

GMU NAMED 'SCHOOL OF DISTINCTION'
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton received a School of Distinction Award from CFES Brilliant Pathways on November 2 during the organization’s national conference at The Sagamore Resort in Bolton Landing.

Superintendent Annette Hammond, PK-12 Principal Heather Wilcox and Librarian Raquel Norton accepted a trophy and banner from College For Every Student (CFES) Brilliant Pathways, which recognized the GMU Central School District for its achievements during the 2018-19 academic year.

Click the link below for the full story!

post_text: Hooray for Kienna and Chelsea!!!
shared_text:
Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES
November 7, 2019 at 2:06 PM ·

On November 3-5, 2019, four students from the DCMO BOCES Harrold Campus SkillsUSA chapter went to the Desmond Hotel in Albany, New York for training. While there, members heard a motivation speech from TV show "Deadliest Catch" former star Nick "Sunshine" Tokman. They worked on professional development skills, and toured the State Capital.

Congratulations to our students:

Lyllian Belcourt - Junior - Culinary Arts - Unatego Central School District
Emily Winchester - Junior - Culinary Arts - Unatego
Kienna Martin - Senior - Culinary Arts - Gilbertsville - Mount Upton Central School District
Chelsea Pope - Senior - Culinary Arts - GMU

Many thanks to Advisors Jeanni Romanowski and Nanette LaTourette for their good humor, patience, and guidance.

Learn more: https://www.skillsusa.org

#WeAreCTE #DCMOAdvantage #SkillsUSA #studentleadership #citizenship

ONE FOR THE BOOKS!
This past summer, GMU kindergarten teacher Jill O’Hara tried to figure out a way to give each of her students a new book from Scholastic every month during the 2019-2020 academic year – at no cost to the child’s family.

So Jill turned to #Facebook in late July, challenging her family and friends to sponsor her students by donating $10 apiece. Click the link below to find out what happened next!

HALLOWEEN PARADE!
We had a ball Thursday afternoon during our annual #Halloween Parade at Gilbertsville-Mount Upton. Set to background music from our GMU Band, students in grades PK-6 lit up the stage for classmates and guests alike. If you missed the parade this afternoon, just scroll down this Facebook page to see a video of our live feed!
#HappyHalloween #GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #Halloween2019

post_text:
THE HONOR IS OURS!
Congratulations to Gilbertsville-Mount Upton's Anika Christensen (flute) and Theodore Sharkey (trombone), who took part in the Hartwick College Honor Band Festival on Saturday, October 26.

Thanks to GMU Music Teacher William Gilchrest for sharing this clip from the performance, which featured 60 students from 20 area schools.

Anika is second from the left in the second row (hoop earrings) while Theodore is in the middle of the third row (white shirt, black bow tie).
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #HartwickHonorsBand2019

post_text:
A SCARY GOOD TIME!
Check out some of the thrills and chills from Gilbertsville-Mount Upton's 2019 Junior Carnival on Friday night.
We welcomed hundreds of children and their families from all over the area for games, prizes and, of course, candy!
Our annual event featured a haunted house, pumpkin contest, prize raffles, concessions, and a baked goods-50/50 benefit for Garrett Proskine.
Thanks to everyone - ESPECIALLY OUR CLASS OF 2021 - for another fun Junior Carnival filled with lots of surprises!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #JuniorCarnival2019

At the end of the night, Our Superintendent, Annette Hammond pulled the winning ticket which said GARRETT! We are excited to be presenting Amy Proskine and Zachary Proskine with $1216.00!!

post_text:
DETERMINED TO FLY HIGH!
Congratulations to all of our PK-2 students who earned Soaring Eagle Awards on Friday morning! The following kids epitomized our theme of “Determination” during the month of October:

Pre-Kindergarten: Landyn Rowe, Abbigail Yost.
Kindergarten: Claire Beach, Mackenzie Miller, Noah Studevant, Blaine Whitbeck.
First Grade: Gigi Barnes, Tenley Fairbairn, Owen Pearson, Garrett Stanton.
Second Grade: Paris Behnke, Kaidyn Rowe.

All were recognized for these traits:
* Doing something without giving up, even when it gets tough
* Having courage, especially when standing up for others
* Setting goals and working toward them
#GreatJobKids #GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SoaringEagleAwards2019

post_text:
THANK YOU, BOE!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton joins the New York State School Boards Association in celebrating School Board Recognition Week (October 21-25).

Recognizing school board member service should be a year-round endeavor, but designating one week to highlight these volunteers’ efforts ensures they receive some of the thanks they deserve.

So when you see a GMU Board Member -- this week or any other time -- be sure to say, "Thanks!"

Our GMU School Board:
Jeremy Pain, President
Larry Smith, Vice President
Jed Barnes
Sean Barrows
Cole Covington
Hillary Giuda-Philpott
Brian Underwood
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #schoolboardrecognitionweek

Anne Burgin shared these photos of Drawing and Painting students Sadie Seneck (blue shirt) and Alivia Retz in action. Alivia also posed for a pic with her unique comic strip, which earned some wall space for all to see at GMU.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #OutdoorArt2019

post_text:
THE DRIVE TO SUCCEED!
Congratulations to Gilbertsville-Mount Upton junior James Raymond and senior Aaron Button, who recently took part in tractor and bulldozing competitions, respectively, during Cobleskill High School Day.

James attends the CTE Conservation and Heavy Equipment program at Delaware-Chenango-Madison-Otsego BOCES, which he represented in the tractor-driving competition as a member of its FFA program. Aaron also attends the Conservation program and competed in bulldozer driving at Cobleskill.

Great job, fellas!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #CobleskillHSDay2019

post_text:
THANK YOU AMPHENOL!
GMU School Counselor Clara Tanner and Science Teacher Kaitlyn Woods accompanied a group of nine sophomores to Amphenol Aerospace in Sidney for Amphenol Manufacturing Day on October 4.
Our students learned all about the history of Amphenol, toured the plant and discovered the numerous employment opportunities the company provides for our local community.
We would like to thank Amphenol for giving us another chance to broaden our students’ horizons!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #AmphenolVisit2019

READING CHALLENGE COMPLETE!
Students who completed Gilbertsville-Mount Upton’s Summer Reading Challenge recently took a trip to Sidney Memorial Public Library and Joe & Vinny's Pizzeria to celebrate.

In addition to enjoying some terrific food, 12 kids signed up for their own library cards for the first time to highlight the trip.

GMU Literacy Specialist Lauren Weidman, who shared these photos, said she’s looking forward to having even more students take the Summer Reading Challenge next year!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SummerReadingChallenge2019

BACKPACK PROGRAM RAFFLES!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton will hold drawings for a turkey in November and a ham in December to support its Backpack Program.
The drawing for GMU’s Backpack Turkey Raffle is set for November 15, with the Backpack Ham Raffle drawing to follow December 19.
Raffle tickets cost $1 apiece, or $5 for six. To order/purchase tickets or for more information, email Raquel Norton at rnorton@gmucsd.org or call her at 607-783-2207, ext. 1167.

post_text:
SAY HELLO TO ... SARA JO BARNES!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton welcomes Sara Jo Barnes as an Aide for the 2019-2020 academic year.

The 2005 GMU graduate earned her associate's degree in Culinary Arts from SUNY Delhi, worked at Hartwick College as a cook for ARAMARK Food Services for four years, then spent six years as a cook at Springbrook.

Sara grew up in Mount Upton, New York (maiden name Frank) and served GMU as a substitute teacher last year. She said she is looking forward to spending more time with her children, baking and decorating cakes, and giving back to her alma mater as an aide.

Sara lives on a farm in South New Berlin with her husband, son and daughter. Her husband’s family owns CoBar Dairy in Rockdale.

#GMUnity #GoGMU #ItsNiceToSayHello #NewFaces2019

post_text:
SAY HELLO TO ... TYLER LINDSLEY!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton welcomes Tyler Lindsley to its family as he will as serve the Raiders as our auditorium supervisor / aide during the 2019-2020 school year.

A 2017 GMU graduate, Tyler has worked in the theater for most of his life. He has ties to several local groups, including the Orpheus Theatre, Inc., the Norwich Theater Company, Inc and the Afton Community Theater, to name a few. Tyler also serves on the board for the Afton Community Theater and works as a teaching artist during its summer workshop series.

Tyler has helped local schools with musical productions as well. He also enjoys dance, music and cats.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #ItsNiceToSayHello #NewFaces2019

SAY HELLO TO ... JILL O'HARA!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton welcomes Jill O’Hara as its Kindergarten teacher for the 2019-2020 academic year.

Jill grew up in the Finger Lakes area, graduated high school from the South Seneca Central School District, then earned her bachelor’s degree in Elementary Education at Western Governors University.

She recently finished student-teaching at the Sherburne-Earlville Central School District, where she served as a substitute teacher during the 2018-2019 school year.

Jill lives in Sherburne New York with her husband, two children and two dogs.

post_text:
SAY HELLO TO ... LISA RYTHER!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton welcomes Lisa Ryther as its Elementary School Counselor for the 2019-2020 academic year.
A Castleton University graduate (1999), Lisa earned a bachelor’s degree in Social Work and Sociology and continued her education with a master’s of science in Clinical Mental Health Counseling. As a certified school counselor with more than 20 years of experience in education and mental health, Lisa specializes in play therapy and Sand Tray Therapy.
Lisa grew up in northern New Jersey. She lives in #Oneonta with her fiancé, son, daughter, two pugs, one Teacup Yorkie and one tortoise-shell cat.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #ItsNiceToSayHello #NewFaces2019

Gilbertsville-Mount Upton welcomes Shania Speenburgh as its new Middle School Social Studies teacher for the 2019-2020 academic year.

A Jefferson Csd graduate (Class of 2015), Shania earned her bachelor’s degree in Arts and History from Hartwick College. Shania served her alma mater as a substitute teacher for three years but is already familiar with the students, faculty and staff at GMU, where she completed her student-teaching requirements last spring.

Shania, who also works for a summer camp, lives with her dog on a farm in Jefferson.

Gilbertsville-Mount Upton English teacher Aimee Piedmonte was awarded the prestigious Smithsonian American Art Museum - SAAM’s Summer Institute: Teaching the Humanities through Art this past summer.
Aimee joined other middle and high school educators during the weeklong workshop in early July, spending nearly 40 hours at the Smithsonian American Art Museum in Washington, D.C.

post_text:
READ ALL ABOUT IT!
Congratulations to all of the Gilbertsville-Mount Upton students who completed our 2019 Summer Reading Challenge!

Each of the students listed read for at least 20 minutes every day of summer vacation. We are so proud of their commitment to education and dedication to becoming lifelong readers!

Mrs. Weidman said she is excited to see such a large increase in student participation, going from three last year to 16 this year. These student will join Mrs. Weidman for a celebratory field trip to the Sidney Memorial Library and Joe & Vinny's Pizzeria next month.

Keep reading!

First grade: Gigi Barnes, Hannah Carbone, Addison Dickey, Sullivan Dickey, Bryce Gundlach, Margaret Hanehan, Garrett Stanton.

Second grade: Lily Hauptfleisch.

Third grade: Cooper Gundlach, Thomas Hanehan.

Fourth grade: Gabby Barnes, Carrie Doyle, Sophie Parslow.

Fifth grade: Brandon Kendall.

Sixth grade: Ryan Davis, Johnny Forbes-Conaty.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SummerReadingChallenge2019
Gilbertsville, New York Gilbertsville Free Library Mount Upton, New York

post_text:
WE'RE JUST GETTING STARTED!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton students got their first crack at sprucing up Miss Hughes' old Toyota USA Camry on Monday as we prepare the vehicle for next month's Sanfilippo Smash 4.

Our pre-kindergarten kids clearly enjoyed a hands-on experience before Mr. Cimineri's sixth-graders added original designs to the paint job. We'll keep you up to date on the progress of this super-cool project taking place by the flagpole near our front entrance.

Joey Utter of the Certified Auto Outlet - Oneonta NY will drive the car during the Sanfilippo Smash 4, a demolition-derby fundraiser scheduled for a noon start October 5 at the Otsego County Fair (Morris, NY). The event raises money to help find the cure for Sanfilippo Syndrome, a rare genetic condition that causes fatal brain damage.

For more information, visit the Sanfilippo Smash 4 Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/events/478969615988115/.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #SanfilippoSmash2019

GMU OPEN HOUSE!
Join us September 25 for our “Welcome Back Open House” at the Gilbertsville-Mount Upton Central School District.

An Elementary School Meet and Greet will run from 4:30-6 p.m. in our elementary school classrooms, as well as a middle school/high school Meet and Greet from 5:30-7 p.m. in the big gymnasium. A SADD-sponsored dinner will be available for purchase as well.

Open House also will feature STEAM all night in the big gymnasium and offer helpful information about the following:
* Bassett’s Student-Based Health Clinic
* Booster Club
* Free/reduced-price lunch forms
* Healthy Kids Program extended daycare
* Scouts
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #OpenHouse2019

post_text:
JOIN US WEDNESDAY!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton will host two key events for older students this Wednesday, September 25.
Juniors, seniors and their parents/guardians are invited to participate in Financial Aid Night, which starts at 6:30 p.m. Wednesday.
The Financial Aid Night presentations will take place during our Open House (grades 7-12), which is scheduled to run from 5:30-7 p.m. Wednesday.
For more information, email GMU Middle School/High School Counselor Clara Tanner at ctanner@gmucsd.org or call her at 607-783-2207, ext. 118.
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #FinancialAidNight2019 #OpenHouse2019

post_text:
GMU HOMECOMING 2019!
Wear your blue & gold as Gilbertsville-Mount Upton hosts the following Homecoming 2019 events this weekend!

Friday, September 20
*Pep Rally, 2:30 p.m. in the gym (grades 7-12; sponsored by STUCO)
*Girls Soccer, 4:30 p.m. (vs. Laurens; sponsored by Booster Club)

Saturday, September 21
*Semi-Formal Dance, 7-10 p.m. (grades 9-12; $5 admission; DJ and lights; sponsored by STUCO)
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #Homecoming2019

post_text:
HE MADE IT!
Gilbertsville-Mount Upton elementary school teacher Mary Hankey sent us a special request Thursday morning.
“This is one of my kindergarteners. His name is Nick Schultes and he made GMU (it's even gold/yellow!) out of play-dough during our reading time! Can you share it online?”
Yes; yes we can!
Enjoy this great picture of Nick and his awesome creation, which comes one day before Homecoming 2019!
#GMUnity #GoGMU #QualityOfTheJourney #GMUReadnigTime2019
